title: Amaan Jogia-Sattar
text:
Amaan Jogia-Sattar


Graduate Student in BiostatisticsUCLA Fielding School of Public Health


 Los Angeles, CA


        







About me


Hi, and thanks for stopping by! I’m Amaan, a first-year graduate student in Biostatistics at the UCLA Fielding School of Public Health. I’m interested in how statistical methods can be used to answer meaningful questions in public health and medicine—especially in the areas of genomic data analysis, chronic disease epidemiology, survival analysis, and clinical trial design. These interests are still evolving as I dive deeper into the field.


I earned my undergraduate degree from UC Berkeley (Go Bears!), where I majored in Public Health and minored in Data Science. My research there centered around applying quantitative tools to health problems, including projects in survival analysis, gene expression data analysis, machine learning, and tumor segmentation. You can learn more about that work here.


I was born and raised in sunny Los Angeles, CA, and I’m excited to back in my hometown for graduate school. Outside of academics, I enjoy playing tennis, spending time with my dog Louie, exploring the city with friends, and trying to become a semi-competent cook.








Research Interests

Statistical Genetics

Chronic Disease Epidemiology

Biomarker Discovery and Evaluation

Clinical Trial Design



Education
M.S. in Biostatistics, 2024–2026
UCLA Fielding School of Public Health
B.A. in Public Health, Minor in Data Science, 2020–2024
UC Berkeley School of Public Health
UC Berkeley College of Computing, Data Science, and Society
